BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

Items.Title: Oversight - Implementation of the Racial Justice Charter Provisions.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Implementation of the Racial Justice Charter Provisions.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a New York city freedom trail task force
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York city freedom trail task force.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the installation and maintenance of an informational sign at the intersection of Wall and Pearl Streets in Manhattan to mark the site of New York’s first slave market
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the installation and maintenance of an informational sign at the intersection of Wall and Pearl Streets in Manhattan to mark the site of New York’s first slave market.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, S. Res. 144/H. Res. 269, recognizing the duty of the Federal Government to develop and implement a Transgender Bill of Rights to protect and codify the rights of transgender and nonbinary people under the law and ensure their access to medical care, shelter, safety, and economic security.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Recognizing the duty of the Federal Government to develop and implement a Transgender Bill of Rights (S. Res. 144/H. Res. 269).

Items.Title: Resolution designating November 30 annually as Shirley Chisholm Day in the City of New York to recognize her contributions as an educator, activist, and elected official, who served the people of New York City with passion and dignity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Designating November 30 annually as Shirley Chisholm Day.
